channel.title: Insurance, cost of cars ahhh
channel.description: Ok, well my moms friend was going to sell us a 2001 chevy cavalier (btw I live in America) for $1500 (which is our price range for a down payment type thing, but she wanted only $1500 for it) well turns out she can't sell it cus she can't find another car. Well, I was looking on ebay and there all shit cars for $1500.. I don't want to have to go to a buy here pay here thing because I have to pay for my insurance and I have to get full coverage. Well, This guy is going to sell me a '97 mustang for $500 it needs a new battery, new tires and its perfect. Nothing wrong with tranny, engine etc.. (selling it because hes to old and doesn't want to drive it).. Well, my dad ruled it out because it would be to high for insurance.. so my question is.. how much do you think a '97 mustang would be for a 16 y/o male.. compared to how much is full overage for a 4 cylinder car (mustang is 6 cylinder)

item.title: Insurance, cost of cars ahhh
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

jme:

Or get their licence’s suspended

What did you do jme?

Read full topic

item.title: Insurance, cost of cars ahhh
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Oh yea, it is ridiculous when you are young to be insured on your own, I don’t know why but the prices are orders of magnitude higher.

It’s because most young drivers are idiots and they crash more (apparently)

Read full topic

item.title: Insurance, cost of cars ahhh
item.dc:creator: @vbcoderx vbcoderx
item.description:
@vbcoderx wrote:

ouch… i pay ~$72/month i believe and I have full coverage and listed as the primary driver… Its around $425 every 6 months i believe. I know its substantially cheaper than all of my friends ( $100 - $150 per month).

Read full topic

item.title: Insurance, cost of cars ahhh
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“Uriko, post:14, topic:295735”][quote author=jme link=topic=391732.msg2919604#msg2919604 date=1250687999]

Ok, well my moms friend was going to sell us a 2001 chevy cavalier (btw I live in America) for $1500 (which is our price range for a down payment type thing, but she wanted only $1500 for it) well turns out she can’t sell it cus she can’t find another car. Well, I was looking on ebay and there all shit cars for $1500… I don’t want to have to go to a buy here pay here thing because I have to pay for my insurance and I have to get full coverage. Well, This guy is going to sell me a '97 mustang for $500 it needs a new battery, new tires and its perfect. Nothing wrong with tranny, engine etc… (selling it because hes to old and doesn’t want to drive it)… Well, my dad ruled it out because it would be to high for insurance… so my question is… how much do you think a '97 mustang would be for a 16 y/o male… compared to how much is full overage for a 4 cylinder car (mustang is 6 cylinder)

I think it depends how long you’ve been driving. It does where I live. I pay $500 a month for insurance for my civic.
[/quote]Are you under your dad’s insurance?.. My friend had a civic and was paying $100/month at 17… (under his dad’s insurance), now he’s under his own (19 now) and pays $260.[/quote]

On my own. It should be going down A LOT next year though.

Read full topic

item.title: Insurance, cost of cars ahhh

item.description:
@Starting_up wrote:

Civics are literally the most expensive to insure.

Well, I was looking on ebay and there all shit cars for $1500… I don’t want to have to go to a buy here pay here thing because I have to pay for my insurance and I have to get full coverage. Well, This guy is going to sell me a '97 mustang for $500 it needs a new battery, new tires and its perfect. Nothing wrong with tranny, engine etc… (selling it because hes to old and doesn’t want to drive it)… Well, my dad ruled it out because it would be to high for insurance… so my question is… how much do you think a '97 mustang would be for a 16 y/o male… compared to how much is full overage for a 4 cylinder car (mustang is 6 cylinder)
[/quote]

I think it depends how long you’ve been driving. It does where I live. I pay $500 a month for insurance for my civic. [/quote]Are you under your dad’s insurance?.. My friend had a civic and was paying $100/month at 17… (under his dad’s insurance), now he’s under his own (19 now) and pays $260.

item.title: Insurance, cost of cars ahhh
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:12, topic:295735”][quote author=jme link=topic=391732.msg2919604#msg2919604 date=1250687999]
I think it depends how long you’ve been driving. It does where I live. I pay $500 a month for insurance for my civic.
[/quote]

WTF! I thought Dutch insurances were expensive. If I had a Civic built in 2003, and chose all insurance options, I’d have to pay €194 a month. That would be just under 313CAD.[/quote]
I pay $147 CAD a month, I live in BC, I have no idea how jme’s insurance rate could be that high.

Read full topic

@jme wrote:

Starting up ...:

Ok, well my moms friend was going to sell us a 2001 chevy cavalier (btw I live in America) for $1500 (which is our price range for a down payment type thing, but she wanted only $1500 for it) well turns out she can’t sell it cus she can’t find another car. Well, I was looking on ebay and there all shit cars for $1500… I don’t want to have to go to a buy here pay here thing because I have to pay for my insurance and I have to get full coverage. Well, This guy is going to sell me a '97 mustang for $500 it needs a new battery, new tires and its perfect. Nothing wrong with tranny, engine etc… (selling it because hes to old and doesn’t want to drive it)… Well, my dad ruled it out because it would be to high for insurance… so my question is… how much do you think a '97 mustang would be for a 16 y/o male… compared to how much is full overage for a 4 cylinder car (mustang is 6 cylinder)

I think it depends how long you’ve been driving. It does where I live. I pay $500 a month for insurance for my civic.

item.title: Insurance, cost of cars ahhh
item.dc:creator: @zoltanman zoltanman
item.description:
@zoltanman wrote:

Just get one of your parents to call their insurance agent and get a quote on it.

Read full topic

item.title: Insurance, cost of cars ahhh
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

If you buy a 97 Mustang with a 6-cylinder for $500 you don’t need and it would be stupid to get full coverage. Just get the state minimum insurance and it shouldn’t be that much, they take into account engine size and it isn’t a fast one so the insurance shouldn’t be that much if you stay on your parent’s plan. Certainly much less than full coverage on a new car, not to mention the amount of payments.

Read full topic

item.title: Insurance, cost of cars ahhh
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

[quote=“Starting up …, post:5, topic:295735”][quote author=Uriko link=topic=391732.msg2918279#msg2918279 date=1250607653]
why would u want full coverage… in canada mandatory ones are liability and collision… for a car that cheap, getting full coverage is pointless… (it’s not worth it, as damages could be more expensive than your actual car and your insurance rates will rise up)
[/quote]In the US, if your paying on the car you have to have full coverage…

and I went for online insurance quotes and it said I didn’t meet the standards. But, I’m going on my parents insurance and they haven’t had a wreck in forever and we pay all of our bills on time. So I don’t see why not.[/quote]
In the US you only need compulsory insurance. Fire & theft is optional.

Read full topic

and I went for online insurance quotes and it said I didn’t meet the standards. But, I’m going on my parents insurance and they haven’t had a wreck in forever and we pay all of our bills on time. So I don’t see why not.
